attachments.title: Destroyer: Poison Season review – overwhelming, aggravating, brilliant
attachments.text: Dan Bejar found unexpected late-career success with 2011’s Kaputt, and seems uncomfortable with the high expectations for its followup – but it turns out to be another triumph
attachments.fallback: the Guardian: Destroyer: Poison Season review – overwhelming, aggravating, brilliant

text: Me too - though for some reason this is the one preview that made me realize that the magic is gone with all these pre-release things. I'm trying to hold out for getting the real thing, despite my enthusiasm for this dude.

attachments.title: Stream Yo La Tengo Stuff Like That There - Stereogum
attachments.text: Yo La Tengo are a beloved band for many reasons, but one of the most preeminent is their knack for covering songs in innovative ways. Though Yo La Tengo's influences are disparate, they take a universe of sound and find a way to make those noises coalesce into harmonious balance. Stuff Like That There is the trio's newest album made up mostly of covers, reworkings of old songs, and several new tracks. Structurally, it's a contemporary imitator of 1990's Fakebook. We've already heard their cover of the Cure's "Friday I'm In Love," a remake of I Can Hear The Heart Beating As One's "Deeper Into Movies," and a rendition of Special Pillows' "Automatic Doom," and now you stream the entire album in full below. Stuff Like That There is out 8/28 via Matador.
attachments.fallback: Stereogum: Stream Yo La Tengo Stuff Like That There - Stereogum
